com.github.p4535992.database.datasource.sql

Class SQLUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.p4535992.database.datasource.sql.SQLUtilities

  • public class SQLUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Created by 4535992 on 14/05/2015. jdbcURL # JDBC connection URL for the database. Refer to your JDBC driver documentation for the format for your database engine. Examples: MySQL: jdbc:mysql://servername/databasename PostgreSQL: jdbc:postgresql://servername/databasename Oracle: jdbc:oracle:thin:@servername:1521:databasename HSQLDB: jdbc:hsqldb:mem:databasename (in-memory database) Microsoft SQL Server: jdbc:sqlserver://servername;databaseName=databasename (due to the semicolon, the URL must be put in quotes when passed as a command-line argument in Linux/Unix shells) href: https://devcenter.heroku.com/articles/database-connection-pooling-with-java href: https://www.safaribooksonline.com/library/view/java-enterprise-best/0596003846/ch04.html (very useful) href: http://penguindreams.org/blog/running-beans-that-use-application-server-datasources-locally/ (very useful) href: http://www.codeproject.com/Articles/802383/Run-SQL-Script-sql-containing-DDL-DML-SELECT-state
    Version:
    2015-11-10.
    Author:
    4535992

        public static java.sql.Connection chooseAndGetConnection(java.lang.String dialectDB,

                                                         java.lang.String username,
                                                         java.lang.String password)
        Method to get a Connection from a List to possible choice.
        Parameters:
        dialectDB - the String of the dialectDb.
        host - String name of the host where is the server.
        port - String number of the port where the server communicate.
        database - string name of the database.
        username - string username.
        password - string password.
        Returns:
        the connection.

      • setNewConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection setNewConnection(java.lang.String classDriverName,
                                                   java.lang.String dialectDB,
                                                   java.lang.String host,
                                                   java.lang.String port,
                                                   java.lang.String database,
                                                   java.lang.String user,
                                                   java.lang.String pass)
                                            throws java.sql.SQLException,
                                                   java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Method to set a New Connection.
        Parameters:
        classDriverName - hte class package driver to use e.g. com.sql.jdbc.Driver.
        dialectDB - the dialect of the database e.g. jdbc:sql.
        host - the host where is allocate the database.
        port - the port to communicate with the database.
        database - the String name of the database.
        user - the String of the username.
        pass - the String of the password.
        Returns:
        the new SQL Connection
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - throw if any error with the SQL is occurred.
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - throw if any error with the Class Driver is occurred.

                                          boolean firstLine,

                                          java.lang.String nameTable,
                                          java.sql.Connection connection)
        Method to import a file CSV to a Database.
        Parameters:
        fileCSV - the File CSv to import.
        firstLine - if true the first line of the file CSV contains the headers of the fields.
        separator - the Cgaracter of the separator field on the CSV file.
        nameTable - the String name of the table.
        connection - the Connection to the Database where execute the query.
        Returns:
        if true all the operation are done.
